value.title: New Field Icons in Power BI
value.excerpt: We can see different icons for our Power BI Fields. Had we ever tried to understand what's the meaning of each icon? Here's an answer. During this video, we will see new Field icons introduced in Power BI Desktop. Microsoft rolled out these new icons with the November 2020 Power BI Desktop update. Here,

value.title: New way to compare Date and DateTime Value in Power BI - August 2021 Feature Summary
value.excerpt: Welcome to one more new update from Power BI Desktop. Sometimes we need to compare date or DateTime value in our DAX expression. At that time, we are using Date() function and Time() function. Now, there's one more easy way to compare Date and Time value in Power BI which is using "dt" keyword before

value.title: Only Retrieve Default List View Columns from SharePoint Online to Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: During this video, we will talk about how we can load the data from the specific ListView to Power BI Desktop. When we are loading data from SharePoint Online List to Power BI Desktop it will load all the columns. This will take some time to load the data into Power BI. With the October 2020 release

value.title: Power BI Tip - Hide Filter Pane From the Published Version of Power BI Report
value.excerpt: In this vlog we will learn about how we can hide the Filter Pane from the published version of the Power BI report. Sometimes there are situations in which we have set our Visual, Page or Report level filter as a part of development logic and we wish that end user should not able to change those values.

value.title: Relative Time Slicer in Power BI
value.excerpt: In this session, we will discuss the new feature rolled out during the April 2020 Update of Power BI Desktop.  Now, we can add  Time Slicer with the OOTB date filter in Power BI.   With Relative Time Slicer, we can filter data based on the time.  Sometimes there are situations, where we need to filter

value.title: 5 ways to get Power BI Support #pbifamily
value.excerpt: Sometimes you need Power BI support. Even if you know a lot about Power BI, everyone has a brain fart from time to time. Adam looks at 5 different ways you can get Power BI support to get you past your hurdle.  Community Site: https://community.powerbi.com Twitter Hashtag: #PowerBI and #pbihelp Facebook
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/OK9i3tuzUMc" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

images.title: 5 ways to get Power BI Support #pbifamily

value.title: Add a domain to your Power BI tenant (Office 365 / Azure Active Directory)
value.excerpt: In this video, Adam looks at how you can add a domain to your Power BI tenant. This is done by adding the domain through Azure Active Directory or Office 365.  LET'S CONNECT! value.title: Another Power BI optimization tool - Report Analyzer

Michael Kovalsky: https://www.linkedin.com/in/michaelkovalsky/  Michael Kovalsky's blog: https://www.elegantbi.com/  Report Analyzer https://www.elegantbi.com/post/reportanalyzer

value.title: Are you backing up your Power BI Dataset???
value.excerpt: While Power BI is a SaaS service, backing up your dataset is still important. What if something was accidently deleted? How do you recover it? Patrick shows you how you can get a backup / restore process in place so you can sleep at night.  Backup/Restore PowerShell Script: https://guyinacu.be/backuprestorescript

value.title: Azure Active Directory and Power BI
value.excerpt: I take a look at how Power BI and Azure Active Directory interact.  Really it is more about Azure Active Directory and how do you get users into AAD.  This came up as I get pinged a lot from folks wondering how they can use AAD with Power BI, not necessarily realizing that it is already there.  http://blogs.technet.com/b/powerbisupport/archive/2015/09/15/azure-active-directory-and-power-bi.aspx

value.title: Configure data sources for Power BI Reports in Power BI Report Server
value.excerpt: In this video, I show you how you can configure the data source of a Power BI report within Power BI Report Server. This comes in really handy when you want to get around the Kerberos Constrained Delegation requirements and avoid having to configure kerberos - which can be a pain.  LET'S CONNECT!  Guy
